title.value: Temporal Graph Benchmark for Machine Learning on Temporal Graphs
title.justification: This is the exact title as provided in the document.
title.quote: Temporal Graph Benchmark for Machine Learning on Temporal Graphs

extractions.description: This paper introduces the Temporal Graph Benchmark (TGB), which is designed to provide challenging and diverse benchmark datasets for evaluating machine learning models on temporal graphs. The benchmark aims to improve the robustness and reproducibility of evaluations, covering both node and edge-level prediction tasks. It also proposes improved evaluation protocols and includes an automated machine learning pipeline.

type.justification: The paper primarily focuses on presenting datasets, evaluating various machine learning models on these datasets, and comparing their performance empirically.
type.quote: We extensively benchmark each dataset and find that the performance of common models can vary drastically across datasets.

name.justification: The paper specifically deals with machine learning on temporal graphs and evaluates different models and datasets related to this field.
name.quote: We present the Temporal Graph Benchmark (TGB), a collection of challenging and diverse benchmark datasets for realistic, reproducible, and robust evaluation of machine learning models on temporal graphs.

name.justification: The focus of the paper is on providing a benchmark to evaluate machine learning models on temporal graphs.
name.quote: We present the Temporal Graph Benchmark (TGB), a collection of challenging and diverse benchmark datasets for realistic, reproducible, and robust evaluation of machine learning models on temporal graphs.

name.justification: DyRep is one of the models used for the evaluation in the research paper.
name.quote: For dynamic link property prediction, we include DyRep [42], TGN [35], CAWN [46], TCL [45], GraphMixer [9], NAT [25], TGAT [48] and two deterministic heuristics namely EdgeBanktw and EdgeBank∞ [33].

is_contributed.justification: DyRep is not a new model contributed by the authors but is used for evaluation purposes.
is_contributed.quote: For dynamic link property prediction, we include DyRep [42], TGN [35], CAWN [46], TCL [45], GraphMixer [9], NAT [25], TGAT [48] and two deterministic heuristics namely EdgeBanktw and EdgeBank∞ [33].

is_executed.justification: The model was executed in the scope of the paper's experiments
is_executed.quote: For dynamic link property prediction, we include DyRep [42], TGN [35], CAWN [46], TCL [45], GraphMixer [9], NAT [25], TGAT [48] and two deterministic heuristics namely EdgeBanktw and EdgeBank∞ [33].

is_compared.justification: DyRep was numerically compared to other models in the study.
is_compared.quote: For dynamic link property prediction, we include DyRep [42], TGN [35], CAWN [46], TCL [45], GraphMixer [9], NAT [25], TGAT [48] and two deterministic heuristics namely EdgeBanktw and EdgeBank∞ [33].

referenced_paper_title.value: DyRep: Learning Representations over Dynamic Graphs
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper's references listed the source title for DyRep.
referenced_paper_title.quote: DyRep: Learning Representations over Dynamic Graphs

name.justification: The dataset 'tgbl-wiki' is one of the datasets specifically mentioned as part of the Temporal Graph Benchmark (TGB).
name.quote: tgbl-wiki. This dataset stores the co-editing network on Wikipedia pages over one month.

referenced_paper_title.value: Predicting Dynamic Embedding Trajectory in Temporal Interaction Networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper draws datasets such as 'tgbl-wiki' from this source as indicated in the references.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The original dataset can be found here [24].

name.justification: PyTorch Geometric is explicitly mentioned as one of the compatible formats for TGB datasets.
name.quote: TGB automatically downloads datasets and processes them into numpy, PyTorch and PyG compatible TemporalData formats.

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch Geometric: A Library for Graph Neural Networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper's references include the source title for PyTorch Geometric.
referenced_paper_title.quote: PyTorch Geometric: A Library for Graph Neural Networks
